item.title: Moebius syndrome: When your face can't show emotions
item.description: Constanze Weigel has Moebius syndrome, a condition that limits those affected in their capacity to form facial expressions. Constanze is often met with prejudice â€” and aims to raise awareness of the syndrome.

item.title: Being old can't be fashionable? An AI artist shows us it sure can!
item.description: Nigerian artist Malik Afegbua uses AI to create elderly models. He wanted to reimagine the roles of older African people after his mother fell ill.
item.keywords: DWVC,fashion, AI, Nigeria, art, youthism, age discrimination, beauty, model

item.title: Dog mutilated by drug cartel could become America's favorite animal
item.description: Pay de Limón had anything but an easy life. Members of a Mexican drug cartel chopped off his front paws. But Pay de Limón survived, got prosthetic limbs and is now a favorite to win the popular competition "America's favorite pet". @DW

item.title: Help for babies in need
item.description: Aida Sadikovic drives through Bosnia and Herzegovina every day. She supplies food, clothing and diapers to babies in need. Many families continue to struggle financially in one of the poorest countries in Europe.
item.keywords: DWVC,child care, poverty, unemployment, Bosnia, Herzegovina, Europe, help

item.title: Natural disasters - and what we can learn from them
item.description: Natural disasters can occur all over the world. But even for countries that got off easy until now, looking abroad for help will only prove to be beneficial!

item.title: Why does Germany want to legalize Cannabis?
item.description: The German government unveiled its plans to legalise cannabis in October 2022. German consumers would be able to buy up to 30 grammes of cannabis for private consumption with supplies cultivated and distributed through a controlled market. But questions remain about possible risks, like the protection of minors.
item.keywords: DWVC,cannabis, legalization, weed, Germany, legalisation, drug

media:content.media:title: Why does Germany want to legalize Cannabis?
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,cannabis, legalization, weed, Germany, legalisation, drug

item.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has fueled a food crisis in many African nations. Experts say the African continent must supply its own sustenance. @DW
